content: i recommend to knit first a pair using sock yarn you will get a pair which will fit a newborn if you use thicker yarn the booties will fit 3-6 month old toddlers and if you ll change the number of stitches you can finally make any size you want the booties are worked in open work and finally sewn together material left overs from sock yarn about 20g per pair double pointed needles instruction cast on 36 stitches row 1 and 2 knit row 3 knit and increase after stitches numer 2/18/19/35 = 40 stitches row 4 and all even row knit row 5 knit and increase after stitches number 3 /19 /22 /38 = 44 stitches row 7 knit and increase after stitches number 4 /2o /25 /41= 48 stitches row 9 knit and increase after stitches number 5 /21 /28 /44 = 52 stitches row 11 knit and increase after stitches number 6 /22 /31 /47 = 56 stitches row 13 knit and increase after stitches number 7 /23 /34 /50 = 60 stitches row 15-26 knit without increasing row 27 knit 35 stitches slip the next stitch knit 1 pass the slipped stitch over the last knitted stitch turn row 28 knit 11 stitches purl 2 stitches together turn row 29 knit 11 stitches slip the next stitch knit 1 pass the slipped stitch over the last knitted stitch turn row 28 and 29 have to be repeated until you have only 15 stitches left on both sides you knit only the middle 11 stitches and turn after decreasing you are finished if you have 42 stitches left on your needles now knit for 10 more row next row *knit 2 stitches together yarn over* repeat this make a row of holes to hold a ribbon knit 6 more row cast off and you re done weave in all threads and close the bootie by sewing © 2008 by angela mühlpfordt angela@bestrickendes de
